thread.title: Pavlyuchenkova beats Friedsam in Linz final for 8th title
thread.title_full: Pavlyuchenkova beats Friedsam in Linz final for 8th title

title: Pavlyuchenkova beats Friedsam in Linz final for 8th title
text:
Pavlyuchenkova beats Friedsam 6-4, 6-3 in Linz final for 8th career title THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   9:48   9:48   
People: 
Austria (29) 

LINZ, Austria — Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova clinched her first title of the season by defeating Anna-Lena Friedsam of Germany 6-4, 6-3 in the final of the Generali Ladies on Sunday. 
It was the eighth WTA title overall for the 29th-ranked Russian, who improved to 8-4 in career finals. 
The 118th-ranked Friedsam was playing in her maiden final. 
The seventh-seeded Pavlyuchenkova — the only seeded player to make it beyond the second round — broke Friedsam in the opening game and avoided break points to take the first set. 
The Russian needed treatment on her right thigh and went down 2-0 in the second set before winning four straight games. She closed out the win by breaking Friedsam's serve for a fourth time.
